column2: The concept of the measures used to ensure the protection of the secrecy of data
This refers to the quality of information
column3: which could cause harm or damage if disclosed.

column2: The act of decision where an operator can influence or control disclosure in order to minimize harm or damage.
The level to which information is mission critical.
The act of hiding or preventing disclosure.
The act of keeping something a secret or preventing the disclosure of information.
This refers to keeping information confidential that is personally identifiable or that might cause harm
column4: or disgrace to someone if revealed.

column2: This involves storing something in an out-of-the-way location. This location can also provide strict access controls.
The act of keeping something separated from others.
